item.title: Rick add a quote by Michael Moorcock
item.description: "This gentleman is known the width and breadth of the comics world as "that bastard Klaw." -- Michael Moorcock

item.title: Rick add a quote by John Waters
item.description: "If you go home with somebody, and they don't have books, don't fuck 'em!" -- John Waters

item.title: Rick add a quote by Archie Goodwin
item.description: "Go to hell, I'm reading!" -- Archie Goodwin

item.title: Rick add a quote by Harry S. Truman
item.description: "Richard Nixon is a no good, lying bastard. He can lie out of both sides of his mouth at the same time, and if he ever caught himself telling the truth, he'd lie just to keep his hand in. " -- Harry S. Truman

item.title: Rick add a quote by William Browning Spencer
item.description: "It's not that [writers] are pompous jerks. We are insecure. We feel like we're fading away in this vast sea of scriveners." -- William Browning Spencer

item.title: Rick add a quote by Stanley Unwin
item.description: "To write books is easy, it requires only pen and ink and the ever-patient paper. To print books is a little more difficult, because genius so often rejoices in illegible handwriting. To read books is more difficult still, because of a tendency to go to sleep. But the most difficult task of all that a mortal man can embark on is to sell a book." -- Stanley Unwin

item.title: Rick add a quote by A.M. Homes
item.description: "If you donâ€™t write the book you have to write, everything breaks." -- A.M. Homes

item.title: Rick add a quote by Franklin Robert Adams
item.description:
"Baseball's Sad Lexicon
These are the saddest of possible words: Tinker to Evers to Chance. Trio of Bear-cubs, fleeter than birds, Tinker to Evers to Chance. Ruthlessly pricking our gonfalon bubble, Making a Giant hit into a double -- Words that are weighty with nothing but trouble: Tinker to Evers to Chance." -- Franklin Robert Adams

item.title: Rick add a quote by Chris Roberson
item.description: "Everything is improved by the judicious application of primates." -- Chris Roberson

item.title: Rick add a quote by Michael Moorcock
item.description: "The book trade invented literary prizes to stimulate sales, not to reward merit." -- Michael Moorcock

item.title: Rick add a quote by Duff Goldman
item.description:
"[A]nything served in a Chinese restaurant is Kosher, even pork.
from <i>[book:The Kosher Guide to Imaginary Animals]</i>" -- Duff Goldman

item.title: Rick add a quote by Alan Moore
item.description: "If we loved Steve Aylett, really loved him in the way that he deserves, a selfless love that genuinely wanted nothing save his happiness and comfort, we'd lobotomise him." -- Alan Moore
